item.title: Using Project Orleans to Build Actor-Based Solutions on the .NET platform
item.description: This article takes a look at Project Orleans, an actor model framework from Microsoft. Version 7 makes it a lot easier to get started with, as it builds on top of the .NET IHost abstraction. This allows us to add it to .NET applications in a simple way. On top of that it abstracts away most of the complicated parts, allowing us to focus on the important stuff, the problems we need to solve.
item.author:
(Chris Klug
Solution Architect & DeveloperFollow)

item.title: C# Dev Kit for Visual Studio Code
item.description: Microsoft has introduced the C# Dev Kit, a new extension to Visual Studio Code, offering an enhanced C# development environment for Linux, macOS and Windows. This kit, combined with the C# extension, uses an open-source Language Server Protocol (LSP) host to provide an efficient and configurable environment.

item.title: Dapr v1.11 is now available
item.description: We’re happy to announce the release of Dapr 1.11.0! 🚀 🎉 🎈 We would like to extend our thanks to all the new and existing contributors who helped make this release happen. If you’re new to Dapr, visit the getting started page and familiarize yourself with Dapr. Docs have been updated with all the new features and changes of this release. To get started with new capabilities introduced in this release, go to the Concepts and the Developing applications pages.
item.author: (By Dapr project maintainers | Monday, June 12, 2023)
